title: Friction - block pulled at different angles

content.question: A string is attached to a block that lies on a horizontal table with a rough surface. In three different trials, the string pulls the block along the table at the same constant velocity to the right. In Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the string is pulled horizontally. In Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the string is pulled at an angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> above the horizontal. In Trial <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, the string is pulled at an angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> below the horizontal. In which trial, if any, is the string tension the greatest?

choices.label: The string tension is the same in all three trials.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
